page.title: 19Weaste industry & recreation
page.content: One of the main buildings in Weaste is a large bus garage. it used to be the tram depot (796 984) but now houses hundreds of buses belonging to Greater Manchester Transport. Just a few hundred yards to the north of this is Salford Rugby League Football Club's ground called 'The Willows' after the name of Salford, which means 'the ford where the willows grow'. It is a popular team and has built a large social club attatched to the ground where people can have a drink or a meal. This raises money to help the club with its running expenses. It is surrounded by streets of terraced houses. (795 989).
